answer_found_by_llm: The analysis reveals that smartscreen.exe (PID 7484) exhibits suspicious behavior. This process shows multiple suspicious memory regions marked as PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE, which is particularly concerning given that smartscreen.exe is supposed to be a Windows security feature. The presence of multiple injectable memory regions in a security process suggests potential compromise and malicious code injection.
The suspicious process smartscreen.exe is located at C:\Windows\System32\smartscreen.exe. This path was identified through the windows.dlllist plugin analysis of PID 7484.

The analysis of network connections reveals that a process named ChromeSetup.exe (PID 4628) attempted to connect to IP address 58.64.204.181 on port 5202. This connection attempt appears suspicious due to the non-standard port number and the destination IP being in an unusual network range.
The IP address 58.64.204.181 is linked to Kwai Chung, a district in Hong Kong.
The SHA1 hash of the suspicious executable (ChromeSetup.exe) is 280c9d36039f9432433893dee6126d72b9112ad2. This hash was calculated from the memory-dumped executable file.
The compilation timestamp of the suspicious executable (ChromeSetup.exe) is December 1, 2019, at 03:36:04 -05:00.
